content.description:
“Yo, this is like The New Rifle, Brah.” The NRB is harder than it looks with a lot of sidepulls and footwork.

Climb the gray rock on the left side of the Overhangs. Currently, it is the leftmost established line in this area.
content.location: This is the leftmost route in the Overhangs.

content.description:
Start the same as

Brothers In Drilling

, and head right, clipping two bolts, to reach the large, long, left-facing dihedral. Continue on gear above to an anchor at the base of the large terrace underneath the headwall.
content.protection: 2 bolts and standard rack to two bolt anchor.
content.location:
Start the same as

Brothers In Drilling

, and head right, clipping two bolts, and climb the left-facing dihedral.

content.description: Climb on sharp, incut edges on black rock, encountering the crux moves underneath the large roof, which is passed on the right. An optional cam (#0.5 or #0.75 Camalot protects final moves. The rating is slightly height-dependent (harder if you’re short, easier if you’re tall). Finish on a ledge.
content.protection: 5 bolts with an optional cam at the top (#0.5 or #0.75 Camalot).
content.location:
Just left of

Brothers in Drilling

, climb the bolted face below the far right side of the big overhang.

content.description: Climb the steep, black granite face with big holds, passing a bulge at the third bolt.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is located just right of the large overhang on the steep, black face. It is just right of

Mi Amor

, another bolted route, and just left of

More Trad Than Rad

, a route that has two bolts leading to a dihedral.

content.description: “Attack of the Block.” Climb a beautiful gray face, moving left underneath the roof and climbing the steep corner and arête above.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a red Camalot to an anchor.
content.location: This is the 3rd route from the left. Look for the beautiful gray and tan rock.

content.description:
Climb a steep face right of

The NRB

. The first 20 feet are powerful, and this is capped with a committing, difficult crux at the 3rd bolt.
content.location:
Just right of

The NRB

, it's the second bolted route from the left.
